alert.note: Alert for Mendocino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 4:31PM PST until January 09 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in California... Navarro River at Navarro affecting Mendocino County. For the Navarro River...including Navarro...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Navarro River at Navarro. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Flooding of Highway 128 approximately 5 miles east of Highway 1 is certain and the road will be closed. Motorists should use alternate routes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 PM PST Monday the stage was 24.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:15 PM PST Monday was 24.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage this evening to 16.6 feet late tomorrow morning. The river may rise again above 20 feet with more rain late Wednesday. - Flood stage is 23.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 24.2 feet on 12/16/2016. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at weather.gov/eka. The next statement will be issued this evening at 700 PM PST.
